docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for New York City and for the thousands of ground zero workers suing the city over health claims have agreed to begin trials in the spring of 2010, The Times reports this morning. The lawsuits claim that workers were not given proper breathing equipment during the operation and suffered illnesses as a result of their exposure to dust at the site. After a hearing on Wednesday, lawyers said they were moving forward with 50 to 60 cases, involving people with the most severe health problems.Nearly 10,000 firefighters, police officers, construction workers and others have sued the city and its contractors, saying they suffered respiratory and other illnesses because they were not given breathing masks during the nine-month rescue and recovery operation. The potential liability is $1 billion or more.

headline.main: Ground Zero Health Claims Move Forward
